definition: to take the credit for sb's achievement
to invite/to request/to intercept/to solicit/to seek

sentences.english: And they go to their boss every year and get a raise because they've done that.
sentences.chinese: 他们每年也会以此向老板邀功并获得加薪。

sentences.english: He's never been all that interested in getting credit for the terrific work he does.
sentences.chinese: 工作表现出色的他从不热衷于争风邀功。

sentences.english: Still, no one seemed eager this week to take credit for honoring Mr.
sentences.chinese: 但是，本周似乎没有人急于邀功。

definition: to show off one's accomplishments (often derog.)
to ingratiate oneself with/to pander to
to request recognition for sb's merits/to recommend sb for promotion or an award
to present a treasure/to offer a valuable piece of advice/to show off what one treasures
to report a heroic deed/to mention sb in dispatches
to get the desired outcome/to win favor by fawning on sb/to curry favor with/a fruitful outcome to reward one's labor
joyfully satisfied/to be immensely proud of oneself/proudly/an air of complacency
to flatter/to fawn on/to butter sb up/toadying/bootlicking
to curry favor by showing obeisance (idiom)
to tell on sb/to complain (to a teacher, a superior etc)/to bring a lawsuit
to use public office to avenge private wrongs
to send punitive forces against/(fig.) to criticize violently
